introduction.content: The NIH HEAL Initiative® is organized into six research focus areas, and cross-cutting research. Within those focus areas, several NIH Institutes and Centers are leading dozens of research programs to find scientific solutions to the opioid crisis.

content.title: Research to Practice
content.content: Use implementation studies to test the integration of evidence-based interventions in an array of settings.

content.title: Prevention and Treatment
content.content: Support research to develop new or improved prevention and treatment strategies for opioid addiction.

content.title: Enhanced Outcomes for Infants and Children
content.content: Support research to address the medical and social needs of infants  and children affected by opioid use disorder

content.title: Novel Medication Options
content.content: Support the development of new medications to treat all aspects of the opioid addiction cycle.

content.title: Pain Management
content.content: Support new clinical trial programs and the expansion of existing programs to evaluate innovative therapies for pain management.

content.title: Preclinical and Translational Research
content.content: Accelerate the discovery and preclinical development of new medications and devices to treat pain

content.title: Cross-Cutting Research
content.content: Many research projects that advance the goals of the HEAL initiative cut across both pain management and addiction.
